What I am saying is that the "that's what you get for having sex (you dumb whore) now deal with it (even though we won't legislate the life of the father this way)" attitude WILL NOT HELP A SINGLE BABY. Not one. Not a single one. I feel the comments indicate a point of view that wants to punish women for their sexuality and not help babies.
 
 
Though it is also true that many people completely do disregard birth control and then go have an abortion as a form of "birth control".

 
 And this is an over-simplification. Why do people choose birth control? Lots of reasons. Those reasons stand whether they used the birth control or not. Now granted, we do want to encourage folks to use it, but in the cases where they don't - you will do more to help those babies if you address the reasons why a woman would choose an abortion than you will in simply out-lawing abortion. 
 
 Take away the reason they feel they need to make that choice and you will be more successful than you would if you just take away the choice. Take away the choice and she will still be facing the reason - and may address it in very drastic ways.
 
 
Just last night when i went into work at my part time job, my 17 year old co-worker told me that she just found out that she's pregnant. She's keeping the kid and accepting the consequences of her actions. She's actually quite excited that she's having a kid and she's not the first friend of mine to become pregnant at that age and keep the kid.

 
 How old are you? I agree that it is commendable that she is going through with the pregnancy, but I do hope she has resources and help lined up. I don't know how many 17 year olds really understand what is involved in parenting. She may want to consider adoption - or open adoption if she still wants to be involved in the child's life. Good luck to her regardless.
 
 
But the pro-life arguement is not about hating women

 
 I think I already said that I know that - and that it was the one post I felt was anti-woman.
 
 
it's based on the fact that there is another life in there, and that if there is another human life involved, under no circumstances should the one life be taken away so that the other human can be bettered financially, emotionally, etc.

 
 Ah yes - but too often the pro-life side completely forget the life of the mother. You can dismiss her emotional and financial situation - but she won't - and successful pregnancies require her cooperation.
 
 
In the case of a woman becoming pregnant by rape, there is another human life becoming involved. Terminating a pregnancy in the case only creates two innocent victims instead of one.

 
 Sorry - I do not squish on this. I have been raped and been a rape counselor and I have been through a pregnancy. To force a woman to make changes as huge a pregnancy require due to the actions of a rapist is simply further violation. A nine month rape.
 
 
If a drunk driver ploughs into your car, you don't try to justify your sorrow by taking a baseball bat to your neighbours car, the situation needs to be dealt with in a different manner. (please don't argue that that comparison is irrelivant, i was comparing how you deal with an issue when someone wrongs you, you don't wrong another innocent person to deal with the situation)

 
 You analogy would work if rape victims were having abortions for revenge. That is not the case. 
 
 
The pregnant woman may be under a lot of distress and a baby may add to it,

 
 You are either male or have never been pregnant or raped. Your purse is stolen and you are distressed. You are raped and you are destroyed. Your own body has been ripped from you. A rape victim needs to feel SAFE first - and that will not happen if another third party (law/government) demand she take responsibility for a pregnancy she did not consent to. Pregnancies demand major lifestyle changes, cost money, and have huge physical and emotional impacts. 
 
 What if she spent a year working to win a full scholarship to a foreign program and this the only semester she can do it?
 
 What if she is about to undergo chemotherapy?
 
 What if she is a single mom who is working a job that she can't when pregnant?
 
 What if she is on meds for a serious physical or mental illness and going off them would put her at risk?
 
 What if she has no insurance and can't afford a doctor?
 
 These are only samples of millions questions any woman pregnant may have to face. To ask the irresponsible to own up is one thing - to demand it of a rape victim is 100% anti-woman.
 
 
but we must recognize that the right to life is the basis of all rights, and if we take away the right to life, all other rights, including choice over your body, is irrelivent.

 
 The rights to one's own body is not irrelevant. Why you might as well make rape. Do you have any clue it is you just said?
 
 
An adoption is still an option in a situation like this,

 
 It is. But in cases like these we are not talking about parenting. We are talking about pregnancy - and whether it is appropriate to demand a rape victim be pregnant against her will.
 
 
and my newly pregnant friend agreed with me on this last night.

 
 And this old broad who has been a mom for ten years says you are way off.
 
 
Even in the case of underground back-alley abortion clinics, they were just as safe as abortions are today, and haven't been any more dangerous since the invention of antibiotics and anesthetics. These procedures, though underground, were performed by qualified physicians who either believed that women should have the choice to kill their unborn child, or just realize that there was a small demand to do so. (The actual statistic on the demand that were presented in Roe vs. Wade were fabricated by the pro-choice community ten times the actual value)

 
 First of all I don't believe that.
 
 And secondly - do you want to do something about abortion or don't you? If all you want are laws that make it invisable so you can pat yourself on the back and pretend you have helped - than keep going down this track. If you want to actually help women facing unplanned pregnancies - you had better start listening to their issues.
 
 
I was not calling them "nudie pictures" myself, but only describing what children talked about when I was a kid, and how these pictures could be interpretated. I myself used to look through "You and Your Health" books (I'm not sure if you're aware of them, they were quite common in homes at a time though now they're generally out-dated). They really did educate me on the human body and the parts of it, though I did enjoy mainly looking at the human reproductive organs, they weren't porno, but they were the next closest thing to it. And then I was able to go to school and amaze the guys by telling them stuff they didn't need to know about all the girl's private parts.

 
 Did your parents talk to you about this stuff in a normal and mature manner? Maybe you were so amazing and amazed by biology books because the subject was such a shhhh hush hush taboo naughty naughty....
 
 
I will say again though what i said before, your son may be responsible for his age and you may feel that he's ready to deal with such knowledge, but my reasons for saying so is that other children are not neccessarily ready for such things, and children do talk. They not only talk about things they find out with their classmates, but they'll like to brag to younger siblings and their friends siblings, who may also really not be ready for such things.

 
 Ready for what?!!! It's like waiting until they are ready to tell them about peeing or pooping. Sex is a normal part of human life. Treating it as such will go a long way.
 
 
My younger brother's main source for such information was always myself.

 
 Why? Could you guys go to your parents and get a straight answer?
 
 
Though i wasn't suggesting to lie to your son about such things, but the possibility of a vague or ambiguous answer to the question. Ever see the movie Coneheads and their interpretation of a condom? "Earthling Bubblebum" I'm suggesting that without prior knowledge about what it is, it's not very obvious about its use.

 
 No.
 
 I try to be as honest and direct with my kid as I can. He is real person, living in the real world. There are some things that aren't age appropriate, but I don't hide them - I explain. "This is not appropriate for you because......" More problems are caused by misleading BS. Why do you spose kids go and whisper wrong info about sex to each other? It's because grown ups aren't being frank.
 
 
If their are age-appropriate things, and sex is included amoung thse at a certain age, it could be considered somewhat of a "toxin" depending on the particular age, would it not?

 
 No, knowing about sex won't hurt kids. 
 
 
Since we cannot deny its existance, but showing kids porn isn't a way to teach them either.

 
 Oh, I don't know.
 
 Stop me if I already told you this.
 
 My friend found a porno of her mom's when she was about 8 and sat down to watch it with a friend hers. Well mom busted them. Instead of freaking, she just want "oh - you want to watch this, huh?" - and made the girls watch several in row, whether they liked it or not. Neither of the girls was impressed or wanted anything to do with it again. My friend turned out just fine - married and has a lovely family now.
